forkee.name: playa-mesos
forkee.description: Quickly build Mesos sandbox environments using Vagrant.  Run apps on top!

comment.body:
Admittedly, a fairly random choice. Basically, we did not validate task IDs before. Do we also want such a high length limit during testing? If the ID doesn't match an existing task, it is mood anyways.

 I think we do not really need to verify it here but my reasoning was that there needed to be at least an app prefix, a dot, and a uuid.

I can use `36` if it doesn't break any tests.

repo.name: marathon
repo.description: Deploy and manage containers (including Docker) on top of Apache Mesos at scale.

repo.name: marathon
repo.description: Deploy and manage containers (including Docker) on top of Apache Mesos at scale.

pull_request.title: Plugin loading mechanism
pull_request.body:
Add modules to load and register plugins. It's using the Marathon Plugin mechanism, as documented in mesosphere/marathon#2827 to load plugins. It also features a loader which loads plugins in "isolation" to avoid collisions.

**Loading procedure**

1. *Marathon UI:* Request a list of installed plugins (plugin_dir, plugin_conf) via `/v2/plugins` as introduced in mesosphere/marathon/pull/3106
2. *Marathon UI:*  Filter plugins by info.modules identifier and load plugin (e.g. `/v2/plugins/example/main.js`) 
3. *Marathon UI:*  Inject the `PluginDisptacher` (proxied) into the plugin and wait for the plugin registration/start up event
4. *Plugin:* Get the injected `PluginDisptacher`
5. *Plugin:* Do the necessary bootstrapping and dispatch the registration/start up event (`PluginHelper.registerMe()`)
5. *Marathon UI:* Update the PluginStore accordingly 

## AC

* [ ] Use the Marathon plugin mechanism to configure and load plugins (mesosphere/marathon#3106) 
* [ ] Move the plugin interface and example plugin implementation to their own repositories: 
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk](https://github.com/mesosphere/mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk)  
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin](https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin)
* [ ] *Isolates* plugins to avoid collisions 
* [ ] Provide a test environment *(including a custom Marathon build for the latest plugin adjustments)*

Closes mesosphere/marathon#3108 and partially mesosphere/marathon#2827

Merge pull request #3199 from mesosphere/mv/fixes_2985

Fixes #2985 by logging a specific message in case of timeout and using an async logger.

issue.title: Marathon cannot schedule task when log writing is blocked
issue.body:
I don't think these two should be related that much. We saw this when running Marathon (both 0.11.1 and 0.14.0RC3) under docker that is very busy, see docker/docker#19209.

```
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 [2016-01-14 00:16:47,422] ERROR error while matching '44bc368b-40c7-4669-8a25-340efc507a2e-O513897' (mesosphere.marathon.core.launcher.impl.OfferProcessorImpl:59)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.Scheduler$$anon$7.run(Scheduler.scala:117)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at akka.pattern.PromiseActorRef$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(AskSupport.scala:335)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 akka.pattern.AskTimeoutException: Ask timed out on [Actor[akka://marathon/user/offerMatcherManager#168703490]] after [1000 ms]
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.run(Scheduler.scala:375)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.execute(Future.scala:597)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.BatchingExecutor$class.execute(BatchingExecutor.scala:109)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.unbatchedExecute(Future.scala:599)
2016-01-14T00:21:02.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.execute(Future.scala:597)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.nextTick(Scheduler.scala:423)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.executeBucket$1(Scheduler.scala:419)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$TaskHolder.executeTask(Scheduler.scala:467)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.execute(Future.scala:597)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 [2016-01-14 00:16:47,422] ERROR error while matching '44bc368b-40c7-4669-8a25-340efc507a2e-O513893' (mesosphere.marathon.core.launcher.impl.OfferProcessorImpl:59)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.run(Scheduler.scala:375)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.Scheduler$$anon$7.run(Scheduler.scala:117)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.executeBucket$1(Scheduler.scala:419)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.unbatchedExecute(Future.scala:599)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$TaskHolder.executeTask(Scheduler.scala:467)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.nextTick(Scheduler.scala:423)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 akka.pattern.AskTimeoutException: Ask timed out on [Actor[akka://marathon/user/offerMatcherManager#168703490]] after [1000 ms]
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 [2016-01-14 00:16:47,422] ERROR error while matching '44bc368b-40c7-4669-8a25-340efc507a2e-O513891' (mesosphere.marathon.core.launcher.impl.OfferProcessorImpl:59)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 akka.pattern.AskTimeoutException: Ask timed out on [Actor[akka://marathon/user/offerMatcherManager#168703490]] after [999 ms]
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.pattern.PromiseActorRef$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(AskSupport.scala:335)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.pattern.PromiseActorRef$$anonfun$1.apply$mcV$sp(AskSupport.scala:335)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.BatchingExecutor$class.execute(BatchingExecutor.scala:109)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.unbatchedExecute(Future.scala:599)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.Scheduler$$anon$7.run(Scheduler.scala:117)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$TaskHolder.executeTask(Scheduler.scala:467)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.BatchingExecutor$class.execute(BatchingExecutor.scala:109)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.executeBucket$1(Scheduler.scala:419)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at akka.actor.LightArrayRevolverScheduler$$anon$8.nextTick(Scheduler.scala:423)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at scala.concurrent.Future$InternalCallbackExecutor$.execute(Future.scala:597)
2016-01-14T00:21:03.000Z 36s54 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

The minimum thing that should be done is error message. It should probably point to the possible source of the error and give some clues how to improve. Ex:

```
Taking too long [1000ms] to match offers, see --max_whatever.
```

Here `--max_whatever` can have some explanations in docs.

pull_request.title: Plugin loading mechanism
pull_request.body:
Add modules to load and register plugins. It's using the Marathon Plugin mechanism, as documented in mesosphere/marathon#2827 to load plugins. It also features a loader which loads plugins in "isolation" to avoid collisions.

**Loading procedure**

1. *Marathon UI:* Request a list of installed plugins (plugin_dir, plugin_conf) via `/v2/plugins` as introduced in mesosphere/marathon/pull/3106
2. *Marathon UI:*  Filter plugins by info.modules identifier and load plugin (e.g. `/v2/plugins/example/main.js`) 
3. *Marathon UI:*  Inject the `PluginDisptacher` (proxied) into the plugin and wait for the plugin registration/start up event
4. *Plugin:* Get the injected `PluginDisptacher`
5. *Plugin:* Do the necessary bootstrapping and dispatch the registration/start up event (`PluginHelper.registerMe()`)
5. *Marathon UI:* Update the PluginStore accordingly 

## AC

* [ ] Use the Marathon plugin mechanism to configure and load plugins (mesosphere/marathon#3106) 
* [ ] Move the plugin interface and example plugin implementation to their own repositories: 
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk](https://github.com/mesosphere/mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk)  
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin](https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin)
* [ ] *Isolates* plugins to avoid collisions 
* [ ] Provide a test environment *(including a custom Marathon build for the latest plugin adjustments)*

Closes mesosphere/marathon#3108 and partially mesosphere/marathon#2827

comment.body: Yeah, but that would mean that we're exposing the `PluginDispatcher` to the plugin. At the moment it's nearly impossible (I'm not aware if the latest plugin sdk removal might have introduced a flaw) for a plugin to dispatch an event to the system without it's plugin id. Thus we can rely on the `pluginId` property and use it in event conditions.

comment.body:
I'll add a helper function to determine the plugin loading state and refactor the respective conditions. 
Adding an `isComplete` getter to the PluginStore is problematic as complete in this case means every state but initial and loading is complete and in other cases could mean something different e.g. only if every plugin loads successfully the whole process is complete.

comment.body:
Curious question:
Is it possible to derive from the PluginDispatcher like this?
```JavaScript
export default class PluginDispatcherProxy extends PluginDispatcher {
```

Then you could get rif of the simple forwarding of `register`, `unregister`, `waitFor` and so..

2. *Marathon UI:*  Filter plugins by info.modules identifier and load plugin (e.g. `/v2/plugins/example/main.js`) 
3. *Marathon UI:*  Inject the `PluginDisptacher` (proxied) into the plugin and wait for the plugin registration/start up event
4. *Plugin:* Get the injected `PluginDisptacher`
5. *Plugin:* Do the necessary bootstrapping and dispatch the registration/start up event (`PluginHelper.registerMe()`)
5. *Marathon UI:* Update the PluginStore accordingly 

## AC

* [ ] Use the Marathon plugin mechanism to configure and load plugins (mesosphere/marathon#3106) 
* [ ] Move the plugin interface and example plugin implementation to their own repositories: 
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk](https://github.com/mesosphere/mesosphere/marathon-ui-plugin-sdk)  
	* [mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin](https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon-ui-example-plugin)
* [ ] *Isolates* plugins to avoid collisions 
* [ ] Provide a test environment *(including a custom Marathon build for the latest plugin adjustments)*

Closes mesosphere/marathon#3108 and partially mesosphere/marathon#2827

commits.message: Add sbt task to run npm build
Refactor file locations and remove garbage
Listen on example event in example plugin
Wait with polling until plugin bootstrap is completed
Introduce global Marathon UI Plugin API and plugin helper
Introduce read-only but extensible mount points file
Add read only plugin events constants file
Introduce read-only plugin actions contant file

Update Marathon Docker image

Use a new Marathon Docker image which includes the latest Marathon UI plugin
interface/loader (mesosphere/marathon-ui#596) features.
Add sbt task to run npm build

commits.message:
Remove the plugin SDK

Remove the plugin SDK and directly access the plugin interface which is
provided via the plugin loader as requested by @aldipower. For details about this decision please refer to
https://github.com/mesosphere/marathon-ui/pull/609/files#r52335225

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,16 @@ case class Task(
   def withLaunched(update: Launched => Launched): Task =
     copy(launched = launched.map(update))
 
+  def ipAddresses: Iterable[MesosProtos.NetworkInfo.IPAddress] = launched.map(_.ipAddresses).getOrElse(Iterable.empty)
comment.body: Thanks for moving that functionality here.
